name.Description: The resource name

sku.Description: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CDN profile.

properties.Description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a profile.

name.Description: Name of the pricing tier.
The resource name

properties.Description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

hostName.Description: The host name of the endpoint structured as {endpointName}.{DNSZone}, e.g. contoso.azureedge.net

origins.Description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN.

originHostHeader.Description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

originPath.Description: A directory path on the origin that CDN can use to retrieve content from, e.g. contoso.cloudapp.net/originpath.

contentTypesToCompress.Description: List of content types on which compression applies. The value should be a valid MIME type.

isCompressionEnabled.Description: Indicates whether content compression is enabled on CDN. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on CDN when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

isHttpAllowed.Description: Indicates whether HTTP traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

isHttpsAllowed.Description: Indicates whether HTTPS traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

queryStringCachingBehavior.Description: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

optimizationType.Description: Specifies what scenario the customer wants this CDN endpoint to optimize for, e.g. Download, Media services. With this information, CDN can apply scenario driven optimization.

probePath.Description: Path to a file hosted on the origin which helps accelerate delivery of the dynamic content and calculate the most optimal routes for the CDN. This is relative to the origin path.

geoFilters.Description: List of rules defining the user's geo access within a CDN endpoint. Each geo filter defines an access rule to a specified path or content, e.g. block APAC for path /pictures/

deliveryPolicy.Description: A policy that specifies the delivery rules to be used for an endpoint.

webApplicationFirewallPolicyLink.Description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for the endpoint (if applicable)

name.Description: Origin name

properties.Description: Properties of the origin created on the CDN endpoint.

hostName.Description: The address of the origin. It can be a domain name, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address.

httpPort.Description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535

httpsPort.Description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535

relativePath.Description: Relative path applicable to geo filter. (e.g. '/mypictures', '/mypicture/kitty.jpg', and etc.)

action.Description: Action of the geo filter, i.e. allow or block access.

countryCodes.Description: Two letter country codes defining user country access in a geo filter, e.g. AU, MX, US.

rules.Description: A list of the delivery rules.

name.Description: Name of the rule

order.Description: The order in which the rules are applied for the endpoint. Possible values {0,1,2,3,………}. A rule with a lesser order will be applied before a rule with a greater order. Rule with order 0 is a special rule. It does not require any condition and actions listed in it will always be applied.

conditions.Description: A list of conditions that must be matched for the actions to be executed

actions.Description: A list of actions that are executed when all the conditions of a rule are satisfied.

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the condition.

name.Description: The name of the condition for the delivery rule.

selector.Description: Name of Cookies to be matched

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the condition.

name.Description: The name of the condition for the delivery rule.

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

selector.Description: Name of PostArg to be matched

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: Match values to match against. The operator will apply to each value in here with OR semantics. If any of them match the variable with the given operator this match condition is considered a match.

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

selector.Description: Name of Header to be matched

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

negateCondition.Description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

matchValues.Description: The match value for the condition of the delivery rule

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the action.

name.Description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

cacheType.Description: The level at which the content needs to be cached.

cacheDuration.Description: The duration for which the content needs to be cached. Allowed format is [d.]hh:mm:ss

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the action.

name.Description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

queryParameters.Description: query parameters to include or exclude (comma separated).

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the action.

name.Description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

headerName.Description: Name of the header to modify

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the action.

name.Description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the action.

name.Description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

redirectType.Description: The redirect type the rule will use when redirecting traffic.

destinationProtocol.Description: Protocol to use for the redirect. The default value is MatchRequest

customPath.Description: The full path to redirect. Path cannot be empty and must start with /. Leave empty to use the incoming path as destination path.

customHostname.Description: Host to redirect. Leave empty to use the incoming host as the destination host.

customQueryString.Description: The set of query strings to be placed in the redirect URL. Setting this value would replace any existing query string; leave empty to preserve the incoming query string. Query string must be in <key>=<value> format. ? and & will be added automatically so do not include them.

customFragment.Description: Fragment to add to the redirect URL. Fragment is the part of the URL that comes after #. Do not include the #.

parameters.Description: Defines the parameters for the action.

name.Description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

sourcePattern.Description: define a request URI pattern that identifies the type of requests that may be rewritten. Currently, source pattern uses a prefix-based match. To match all URL paths, use "/" as the source pattern value. To match only the root directory and re-write this path, use the origin path field

destination.Description: Define the destination path for be used in the rewrite. This will overwrite the source pattern

preserveUnmatchedPath.Description: If True, the remaining path after the source pattern will be appended to the new destination path.

name.Description: The resource name

properties.Description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the custom domain to create.

hostName.Description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

resourceState.Description: Resource status of the custom domain.

customHttpsProvisioningState.Description: Provisioning status of Custom Https of the custom domain.

customHttpsProvisioningSubstate.Description: Provisioning substate shows the progress of custom HTTPS enabling/disabling process step by step.

customHttpsParameters.Description: Certificate parameters for securing custom HTTPS

validationData.Description: Special validation or data may be required when delivering CDN to some regions due to local compliance reasons. E.g. ICP license number of a custom domain is required to deliver content in China.

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning status of the custom domain.

protocolType.Description: Defines the TLS extension protocol that is used for secure delivery.

minimumTlsVersion.Description: TLS protocol version that will be used for Https

certificateSourceParameters.Description: Defines the certificate source parameters using user's keyvault certificate for enabling SSL.

certificateSource.Description: Defines the source of the SSL certificate.

subscriptionId.Description: Subscription Id of the user's Key Vault containing the SSL certificate

resourceGroupName.Description: Resource group of the user's Key Vault containing the SSL certificate

vaultName.Description: The name of the user's Key Vault containing the SSL certificate

secretName.Description: The name of Key Vault Secret (representing the full certificate PFX) in Key Vault.

secretVersion.Description: The version(GUID) of Key Vault Secret in Key Vault.

updateRule.Description: Describes the action that shall be taken when the certificate is updated in Key Vault.

deleteRule.Description: Describes the action that shall be taken when the certificate is removed from Key Vault.

certificateSourceParameters.Description: Defines the certificate source parameters using CDN managed certificate for enabling SSL.

certificateSource.Description: Defines the source of the SSL certificate.

name.Description: The resource name

properties.Description: Properties of the web application firewall policy.

etag.Description: Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

sku.Description: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicy.

rateLimitRules.Description: Describes rate limit rules inside the policy.

customRules.Description: Describes custom rules inside the policy.

managedRules.Description: Describes managed rules inside the policy.

endpointLinks.Description: Describes Azure CDN endpoints associated with this Web Application Firewall policy.

enabledState.Description: describes if the policy is in enabled state or disabled state

mode.Description: Describes if it is in detection mode or prevention mode at policy level.

defaultRedirectUrl.Description: If action type is redirect, this field represents the default redirect URL for the client.

defaultCustomBlockResponseStatusCode.Description: If the action type is block, this field defines the default customer overridable http response status code.

defaultCustomBlockResponseBody.Description: If the action type is block, customer can override the response body. The body must be specified in base64 encoding.

rateLimitDurationInMinutes.Description: Defines rate limit duration. Default is 1 minute.

name.Description: Defines the name of the custom rule

enabledState.Description: Describes if the custom rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

priority.Description: Defines in what order this rule be evaluated in the overall list of custom rules

action.Description: Describes what action to be applied when rule matches

selector.Description: Selector can used to match a specific key for QueryString, Cookies, RequestHeader or PostArgs.

negateCondition.Description: Describes if the result of this condition should be negated.

name.Description: Defines the name of the custom rule

enabledState.Description: Describes if the custom rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

priority.Description: Defines in what order this rule be evaluated in the overall list of custom rules

action.Description: Describes what action to be applied when rule matches

ruleSetType.Description: Defines the rule set type to use.

ruleSetVersion.Description: Defines the version of the rule set to use.

anomalyScore.Description: Verizon only : If the rule set supports anomaly detection mode, this describes the threshold for blocking requests.

ruleGroupOverrides.Description: Defines the rule overrides to apply to the rule set.

ruleGroupName.Description: Describes the managed rule group within the rule set to override

rules.Description: List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.

enabledState.Description: Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Disabled if not specified.

action.Description: Describes the override action to be applied when rule matches.

name.Description: The resource name

properties.Description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

hostName.Description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.

httpPort.Description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.Description: The value of the https port. Must be between 1 and 65535.
